results.title: The Runaway Brain
results.creator_credit: John Bassett and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Planet for the Taking”.
This programme asks the central question, can we begin to see ourselves not as dominant but as integral, as just one part of the complex pattern of matter and life. Host David Suzuki talks to some of the world’s greatest thinkers about whether science and technology can solve the problems they have created.

results.title: Human Nature
results.creator_credit: John Bassett and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Planet for the Taking”.
Host, David Suzuki introduces this program with an update on the global environmental crises. Filmed in Botswana, Tanzania, Kenya and the U.S.A, human nature is an exploration of the origins of the human species and the biological inheritance we share with other life forms.

results.title: Margaret Kernohan: A Commitment to care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Pattern of People”.
Children’s Hearings have been set up in Scotland as informal community tribunals to assess the background and needs of children in trouble. Traces the case of Willie Reid, a neglected boy caught shoplifting. The case is reported to Margaret Kernohan who convenes the hearing at which Willie and his parents are summoned to appear. In earlier days the boy would have been brought before the Juvenile Court and probably punished.

results.title: John Forrest: Clydeside computer
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and London Television Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Pattern of People”.
John Forrest is a marine engineer leading a team of designers and engineers using a complex hybrid computer in one of the Glasgow shipyards. The film shows Forrest’s team at work on board ship, in the yards and, in an entirely different field, building a mathematical model of the blood’s chemical processes for the purposes of medical research.

results.title: Edward Presley: a man of assurance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Pattern of People”.
Edward Presley is one of the many people employed by Lloyds of London. This film examines the history and present day operations of the largest insurance company in the world. Narrated by James Mason

results.title: A New vision
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A short series of films about great artists which aims to entertain and excite audience attention as well as to inform, by blending computer animation and graphics, traditional animation and, where appropriate, live action with shots of the works under discussion.

results.title: Rikki-tikki-tavi
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
An animated version of Rudyard Kipling’s tale of a mongoose who is saved from a storm by a boy and his parents, and then becomes the family’s defender against the dreaded cobras that roam the compound. Narrated by Orson Welles. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The White seal
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
Based on a tale in Kipling’s “The Jungle Book”, this exciting animated film follows the exploits of Kotick, the white seal, as he struggles to survive and save his friends from seal hunters in the Bering Sea. Narrated by Roddy McDowall to music from Beethoven’s Sixth Symphony. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
